intro: Cassipourea toroensis, commonly known as the Toronese tamarind, is a small evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The tree produces yellowish-orange fruits that are roughly spherical and contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
